intro: Brassica rapa var. cylindrica, commonly known as the Chinese kale or Chinese broccoli, is a cultivar of the mustard family (Brassicaceae). It is characterized by its thick, stalked leaves and edible flower clusters, which are used in various Asian cuisines. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in cool climates. It is a biennial plant, though it is often grown as an annual in temperate regions. The leaves and stems are rich in nutrients, making it a valuable vegetable in both culinary and nutritional contexts.
